dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 1830 IH: Closing the Loophole on Interstate Firearm Sales Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Crow (for himself, Mr. Raskin, Ms. Norton, Mr. Neguse, and Ms. Tlaib) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To prohibit a Federal firearms licensee from transferring a long gun to a person who the licensee knows or has reasonable cause to believe does not reside in (or if the person is a corporation or other business entity, does not maintain a place of business in) the State in which the licensee’s place of business is located.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Closing the Loophole on Interstate Firearm Sales Act.

section.header: Extension to long guns of ban on licensee transfer of firearm to out-of-State person
section.text: Section 922(b)(3) of title 18, United States Code, is amended by striking (A) and all that follows through (B).
